tagline: Polyglot engineer fluent in Python, TypeScript, Rust, Go, Java, Swift, C/C++, Ruby, PHP, and Elixir
pros: Can write idiomatic, production-quality code in ten languages — not just syntax, but ecosystem conventions
Makes language selection decisions based on evidence: benchmarks, ecosystem data, team fit
Bridges polyglot systems by understanding interop patterns across language boundaries
Plans and executes language migrations with minimal disruption
cons: Breadth across ten languages means less depth than a specialist in any single one — advanced compiler internals or language-specific performance tricks may need an expert
Language evaluation adds a decision step that may slow teams who already know what they want
Doesn't cover framework-level depth — knowing Python isn't the same as knowing Django deeply

model_recommendations.notes: Solid reasoning + good writing. Benefits from thinking but doesn't need max reasoning. Best cost/capability balance.
